texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: NANYANG JUNIOR COLLEGE JC 2 PRELIMINARY EXAMINATION Higher 1
texts.text: NANYANG JUNIOR COLLEGE JC 2 PRELIMINARY EXAMINATION Higher 1
texts.translated_text: 南洋初级学院二年级预考 高一级

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: S（这个输入似乎不完整，如果需要翻译完整的句子或文本，请提供更多信息。）

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: 第二篇 结构化问题

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Candidates answer on the Question Paper.
texts.text: Candidates answer on the Question Paper.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Write your name, class, Centre number and index number in the spaces at the top of this page.
texts.text: Write your name, class, Centre number and index number in the spaces at the top of this page.
texts.translated_text: 在本页顶部的空间内填写你的姓名、班级、中心编号和索引号。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Write in dark blue or black pen on both sides of the paper. You may use a HB pencil for any diagrams, graphs or rough working. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.
texts.text: Write in dark blue or black pen on both sides of the paper. You may use a HB pencil for any diagrams, graphs or rough working. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.
texts.translated_text: 用暗蓝色或黑色的笔在纸张的正反两面作答。绘制图表或草稿时可以使用HB铅笔。不要使用订书钉、曲别针、胶水或涂改液。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The use of an approved scientific calculator is expected, where appropriate.
texts.text: The use of an approved scientific calculator is expected, where appropriate.
texts.translated_text: 适当的场合预期会使用经批准的科学计算器。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The   number   of   marks   is   given   in   brackets   [    ]   at   the   end   of   each   question   or   part question.
texts.text: At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The   number   of   marks   is   given   in   brackets   [    ]   at   the   end   of   each   question   or   part question.
texts.translated_text: 考试结束时，将所有作业牢固地整理在一起。每个问题或部分问题末尾的方括号[ ]内给出了分数。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This document consists of 24 printed pages.
texts.text: This document consists of 24 printed pages.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: speed of light in free space
texts.text: speed of light in free space

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: 阿伏伽德罗常数 NA = 6.02 × 10²³ mol⁻¹

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Answer all the questions in the spaces provided.
texts.text: Answer all the questions in the spaces provided.
texts.translated_text: 在指定的空间内回答所有问题。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 When   an   object   moves   relative   to   a   fluid,   the   fluid   exerts   a   drag   force F D on   the   object   due   to the   viscosity   of   the   fluid.   Under   non-turbulent   conditions,   the   drag   force F D on   a   sphere   moving in a tube of fluid is given by
texts.text: 1 When   an   object   moves   relative   to   a   fluid,   the   fluid   exerts   a   drag   force F D on   the   object   due   to the   viscosity   of   the   fluid.   Under   non-turbulent   conditions,   the   drag   force F D on   a   sphere   moving in a tube of fluid is given by
texts.translated_text: 当一个物体相对于流体运动时，由于流体的粘性，流体会对物体施加一个阻力Fd。在非湍流条件下，流体管中移动的球体所受的阻力Fd可由以下公式给出：

texts.label: text
texts.orig: where η is the viscosity of the fluid, r is the radius of the sphere and, v is the velocity of the sphere.
texts.text: where η is the viscosity of the fluid, r is the radius of the sphere and, v is the velocity of the sphere.
texts.translated_text: 其中η是流体的粘度，r是球的半径，v是球的速度。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Show that the base units of viscosity η are kg   m -1 s -1 .
texts.text: (a) Show that the base units of viscosity η are kg   m -1 s -1 .
texts.translated_text: 证明粘度η的基本单位是kg/m·s。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) A   sphere   of   diameter   =   (2.0   ±   0.1)   cm   falls   under   non-turbulent   conditions   through   a   fluid of viscosity = (0.13 ± 0.02) kg m    -1    s -1 .
texts.text: (b) A   sphere   of   diameter   =   (2.0   ±   0.1)   cm   falls   under   non-turbulent   conditions   through   a   fluid of viscosity = (0.13 ± 0.02) kg m    -1    s -1 .
texts.translated_text: 一个直径为 (2.0 ± 0.1) 厘米的球在无湍流条件下通过粘度为 (0.13 ± 0.02) 千克/(米·秒) 的流体中落下。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A    student    determines    the    velocity    through    the    liquid    to    be    2.7    m    s -1 and   estimates   the percentage uncertainty associated with this quantity to be 5 %.
texts.text: A    student    determines    the    velocity    through    the    liquid    to    be    2.7    m    s -1 and   estimates   the percentage uncertainty associated with this quantity to be 5 %.
texts.translated_text: 一名学生确定液体中的速度为2.7米/秒，并估计该量的百分比不确定度为5%。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Determine F D , with its associated uncertainty,   acting on the sphere.
texts.text: (i) Determine F D , with its associated uncertainty,   acting on the sphere.
texts.translated_text: 确定作用在球体上的力FD及其相关不确定性。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) The true value for F D is 3.0   ×   10 -2 N.
texts.text: (ii) The true value for F D is 3.0   ×   10 -2 N.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: State and explain if systematic error is significant in the experimental procedure.
texts.text: State and explain if systematic error is significant in the experimental procedure.
texts.translated_text: 说明并解释系统误差在实验程序中是否显著。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 (a) A   body   has   an   initial   velocity u and   an   acceleration a .   After   a   time t ,   the   body   has   moved   a displacement s and has a final velocity v . One of   the equations of motion of this body is
texts.text: 2 (a) A   body   has   an   initial   velocity u and   an   acceleration a .   After   a   time t ,   the   body   has   moved   a displacement s and has a final velocity v . One of   the equations of motion of this body is
texts.translated_text: 一个物体具有初速度u和加速度a。经过时间t后，该物体移动了位移s并具有末速度v。这个物体的运动方程之一是

texts.label: text
texts.orig: State the conditions that must be satisfied for   the above equation to be valid.
texts.text: State the conditions that must be satisfied for   the above equation to be valid.
texts.translated_text: 上述方程成立必须满足什么条件？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) A   hot   air   balloon   is   moving   at   a   constant   velocity   of   11.7   m   s -1 ,   at   an   angle   of   59°   from   the horizontal, as shown in Fig. 2.1.
texts.text: (b) A   hot   air   balloon   is   moving   at   a   constant   velocity   of   11.7   m   s -1 ,   at   an   angle   of   59°   from   the horizontal, as shown in Fig. 2.1.
texts.translated_text: 一个热气球正以恒定的速度11.7米/秒移动，与水平方向成59°角，如图2.1所示。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Determine the vertical component of the velocity   of the balloon.
texts.text: (i) Determine the vertical component of the velocity   of the balloon.
texts.translated_text: 确定气球垂直速度分量。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (ii) A   slotted    mass    is    released    from    the    balloon.    Fig.    2.2   shows   the   subsequent   path   of   the slotted   mass.   The   dotted   figure   shows   the   position   of   the   hot   air   balloon   at   the   instant when the slotted mass is released.
texts.text: (ii) A   slotted    mass    is    released    from    the    balloon.    Fig.    2.2   shows   the   subsequent   path   of   the slotted   mass.   The   dotted   figure   shows   the   position   of   the   hot   air   balloon   at   the   instant when the slotted mass is released.
texts.translated_text: (ii) 带槽的质量从热气球上释放。图2.2显示了带槽质量随后的路径。虚线部分表示在释放带槽质量的瞬间热气球的位置。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Throughout   the   motion,   the   slotted   mass   is   observed   to   be   directly   below   the   hot air balloon. Explain why this is so.
texts.text: 1. Throughout   the   motion,   the   slotted   mass   is   observed   to   be   directly   below   the   hot air balloon. Explain why this is so.
texts.translated_text: 在整个运动过程中，可以看到带槽的质量始终位于热气球的正下方。解释一下这是为什么。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Determine   how   far    below    the    balloon   would   the   slotted   mass   be   after   3.0   s.   You   may assume    that    the    slotted    mass    has    not    yet    landed    on    the    ground    and    that    air resistance on the slotted mass is negligible.
texts.text: 2. Determine   how   far    below    the    balloon   would   the   slotted   mass   be   after   3.0   s.   You   may assume    that    the    slotted    mass    has    not    yet    landed    on    the    ground    and    that    air resistance on the slotted mass is negligible.
texts.translated_text: 确定3.0秒后，带槽的质量会距离气球下方多远。你可以假设带槽的质量尚未落地，并且忽略空气阻力对带槽质量的影响。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Describe    qualitatively    the    changes,    if    any,    to    the    answer    in (b)(ii)2 if    a   100    kg cargo    was    dropped    from    the    balloon    instead    of    the    slotted    mass.    Assume    air resistance on the cargo is negligible.
texts.text: 3. Describe    qualitatively    the    changes,    if    any,    to    the    answer    in (b)(ii)2 if    a   100    kg cargo    was    dropped    from    the    balloon    instead    of    the    slotted    mass.    Assume    air resistance on the cargo is negligible.
texts.translated_text: 如果气球释放一个100千克的货物而不是槽形质量，定性地描述（b）（ii）2的答案会有哪些变化？假设货物所受空气阻力可忽略不计。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 (a) State the conditions required for a body to   be in equilibrium.
texts.text: 3 (a) State the conditions required for a body to   be in equilibrium.
texts.translated_text: 一个物体处于平衡状态所需的条件是什么？

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Fig.    3.1    shows    a    lamp    weighing    5.0   N   that   is   hung   from   the   end   of   a   beam   4.50   m   long and weighing 1.0 N, making an angle of 25° below the horizontal.
texts.text: (b) Fig.    3.1    shows    a    lamp    weighing    5.0   N   that   is   hung   from   the   end   of   a   beam   4.50   m   long and weighing 1.0 N, making an angle of 25° below the horizontal.
texts.translated_text: 图3.1显示一个重5.0N的灯悬挂在一根长4.50m、重1.0N的梁的末端，与水平方向成25°角。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The   beam   is    held    in    position    by    a    hinge    at    its    upper    end    and    by    a    cable    3.00    m    lower down   the   beam   and   perpendicular   to   it.   The   centre   of   gravity   of   the   beam   is   2  .  00   m   along the beam from the hinge.
texts.text: The   beam   is    held    in    position    by    a    hinge    at    its    upper    end    and    by    a    cable    3.00    m    lower down   the   beam   and   perpendicular   to   it.   The   centre   of   gravity   of   the   beam   is   2  .  00   m   along the beam from the hinge.
texts.translated_text: 梁的上端通过一个铰链固定，而在距离梁上端3.00米处并通过一根垂直于梁的缆绳进行支撑。梁的重心位于距铰链2.00米处的梁上。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) The   position   of   the   centre   of   gravity   of   the   beam   is   not   at   its   midpoint.   Suggest   what this implies about the distribution of the mass in the beam.
texts.text: (i) The   position   of   the   centre   of   gravity   of   the   beam   is   not   at   its   midpoint.   Suggest   what this implies about the distribution of the mass in the beam.
texts.translated_text: 这表明梁的质量分布不是均匀的。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Show that the tension T in the cable is 7.4 N.
texts.text: (ii) Show that the tension T in the cable is 7.4 N.
texts.translated_text: 证明缆绳中的张力 T 为 7.4 牛顿。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) Determine the magnitude of the force acting   on the beam at the hinge.
texts.text: (iii) Determine the magnitude of the force acting   on the beam at the hinge.
texts.translated_text: 确定铰链处作用在梁上的力的大小。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 A   mass-spring   system   consists    of    a    light    spring    of    unstretched    length l suspended   vertically from   a   fixed   point,   as   shown   in   Fig.   4.1.   A   mass   is   attached   to   the   lower   end   of   the   spring   and is held at rest at length l , as shown in Fig. 4.2.
texts.text: 4 A   mass-spring   system   consists    of    a    light    spring    of    unstretched    length l suspended   vertically from   a   fixed   point,   as   shown   in   Fig.   4.1.   A   mass   is   attached   to   the   lower   end   of   the   spring   and is held at rest at length l , as shown in Fig. 4.2.
texts.translated_text: 一个质量弹簧系统由一根未拉伸时长度为l的轻弹簧垂直悬挂在固定点上组成，如图4.1所示。将一个质量物体连接到弹簧的下端，并保持在长度l处静止，如图4.2所示。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The   mass   is   then   released.   Fig.   4.3   shows   how   the   total   energy E T and   kinetic   energy K of   the mass-spring    system   vary    with    extension x of    the    spring.    The    total    energy    is    1.18    J    and    the maximum    kinetic    energy    is    0.29    J.    The    gravitational    and    elastic    potential    energies    are    not shown.
texts.text: The   mass   is   then   released.   Fig.   4.3   shows   how   the   total   energy E T and   kinetic   energy K of   the mass-spring    system   vary    with    extension x of    the    spring.    The    total    energy    is    1.18    J    and    the maximum    kinetic    energy    is    0.29    J.    The    gravitational    and    elastic    potential    energies    are    not shown.
texts.translated_text: 然后释放质量。图4.3展示了质量-弹簧系统总能量ET和动能K随弹簧伸长量x的变化情况。总能量为1.18焦耳，最大动能为0.29焦耳。重力势能和弹性势能未显示。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Distinguish between gravitational potential energy and elastic potential energy .
texts.text: (a) Distinguish between gravitational potential energy and elastic potential energy .
texts.translated_text: 区分重力势能和弹性势能。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Taking the gravitational potential energy of   the mass at the lowest position to be zero, use information from Fig. 4.3 to
texts.text: (b) Taking the gravitational potential energy of   the mass at the lowest position to be zero, use information from Fig. 4.3 to
texts.translated_text: 将质量在最低位置的重力势能视为零，利用图4.3中的信息来

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) state the gravitational potential energy of   the mass at the point of release,
texts.text: (i) state the gravitational potential energy of   the mass at the point of release,
texts.translated_text: 指出质量在释放点的重力势能，

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) determine the elastic potential energy stored   in the spring when the kinetic energy of the mass is maximum.
texts.text: (ii) determine the elastic potential energy stored   in the spring when the kinetic energy of the mass is maximum.
texts.translated_text: 确定弹簧中存储的弹性势能，此时质量的动能最大。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) the   graph   of   how   the   gravitational   potential   energy   of   the   mass   varies   with   extension x . Label this graph G. [1]
texts.text: (i) the   graph   of   how   the   gravitational   potential   energy   of   the   mass   varies   with   extension x . Label this graph G. [1]
texts.translated_text: (i) 表示质量的重力势能随延伸量x变化的图形。标上标签G。[1]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) the graph of how the elastic potential energy   of the spring varies with extension x . Label this graph E.
texts.text: (ii) the graph of how the elastic potential energy   of the spring varies with extension x . Label this graph E.
texts.translated_text: (ii) 表示弹簧的弹性势能随伸长量x变化的图。将此图标记为E。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5 The   Earth   may   be   assumed   to   be   a   uniform   sphere   of   radius R and   mass M .   The   gravitational force   acting   on   a   satellite   located   at   the   surface   of   the   Earth   is F .   The   satellite   is   then   sent   to orbit around the Earth at a height of 0.30 R above   the Earth's surface.
texts.text: 5 The   Earth   may   be   assumed   to   be   a   uniform   sphere   of   radius R and   mass M .   The   gravitational force   acting   on   a   satellite   located   at   the   surface   of   the   Earth   is F .   The   satellite   is   then   sent   to orbit around the Earth at a height of 0.30 R above   the Earth's surface.
texts.translated_text: 地球可以被认为是一个半径为R、质量为M的均匀球体。位于地球表面的一颗卫星所受的引力是F。然后这颗卫星被送入距离地球表面0.30R的高度绕地球运行。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Show that the gravitational force acting on the   satellite at this height is 0.59 F .
texts.text: (a) Show that the gravitational force acting on the   satellite at this height is 0.59 F .
texts.translated_text: 证明在这个高度作用在卫星上的引力是0.59倍的F。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Determine   the   angular   speed   of   the   satellite   about   the   Earth.   The   radius R of   the   Earth   is 6.4 × 10    6 m.
texts.text: (b) Determine   the   angular   speed   of   the   satellite   about   the   Earth.   The   radius R of   the   Earth   is 6.4 × 10    6 m.
texts.translated_text: 确定卫星绕地球旋转的角速度。地球的半径R为6.4×10^6米。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) Calculate the time, in hours, for one complete   orbit of the satellite.
texts.text: (c) Calculate the time, in hours, for one complete   orbit of the satellite.
texts.translated_text: 计算卫星完成一次完整轨道运行所需的时间，单位为小时。

texts.label: text
texts.translated_text: [h   [2]] 在中文中通常不需要这样的编码或标记，如果您是想表达特定含义或者有具体上下文，请提供更多信息。如果这是某种代码或特殊符号，请明确说明。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) Explain    why    the    satellite    does    not    fall    towards    the    Earth    even    though    the    gravitational force is directed towards the centre of the Earth.
texts.text: (d) Explain    why    the    satellite    does    not    fall    towards    the    Earth    even    though    the    gravitational force is directed towards the centre of the Earth.
texts.translated_text: 解释为什么即使地球的引力指向地球中心，卫星也不会坠向地球。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 (a) Two   cylindrical    resistors    M    and    N    of    the    same    material    are    connected   in   parallel   in   Fig. 6.1.  The mass of M is identical to the mass of N but the radius of M is half the radius of N.
texts.text: 6 (a) Two   cylindrical    resistors    M    and    N    of    the    same    material    are    connected   in   parallel   in   Fig. 6.1.  The mass of M is identical to the mass of N but the radius of M is half the radius of N.
texts.translated_text: 6（a）如图6.1所示，两个由相同材料制成的圆柱形电阻M和N并联连接。M的质量与N的质量相同，但M的半径是N的半径的一半。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) . 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑖𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒   𝑜𝑓   𝑀 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑖𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒   𝑜𝑓   𝑁
texts.text: (ii) . 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑖𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒   𝑜𝑓   𝑀 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑖𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒   𝑜𝑓   𝑁
texts.translated_text: (ii) . M 的电阻 N 的电阻

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) A   cell   of   electromotive   force   (e.m.f.)   1.5   V   and   internal   resistance   1.0   Ω   is   connected   to   a resistor X and a thermistor Y as shown in Fig. 6.2.
texts.text: (b) A   cell   of   electromotive   force   (e.m.f.)   1.5   V   and   internal   resistance   1.0   Ω   is   connected   to   a resistor X and a thermistor Y as shown in Fig. 6.2.
texts.translated_text: 一个电动势为1.5伏特和内阻为1.0欧姆的电池与电阻X和热敏电阻Y连接，如图6.2所示。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: X has resistance of 2.0   Ω   while Y has a resistance   of 6.0   Ω   at room temperature.
texts.text: X has resistance of 2.0   Ω   while Y has a resistance   of 6.0   Ω   at room temperature.
texts.translated_text: 在室温下，X的电阻为2.0欧姆，而Y的电阻为6.0欧姆。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Show that the current in the cell is 0.60 A   when the switch is closed.
texts.text: (i) Show that the current in the cell is 0.60 A   when the switch is closed.
texts.translated_text: 证明当开关闭合时，电池中的电流为0.60安培。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Determine the power dissipated in the cell.
texts.text: (ii) Determine the power dissipated in the cell.
texts.translated_text: 确定电池中消耗的功率。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The temperature of Y gradually increases. State and explain the change, if any, to the power   dissipated in the cell.
texts.text: The temperature of Y gradually increases. State and explain the change, if any, to the power   dissipated in the cell.
texts.translated_text: Y的温度逐渐升高。说明并解释单元中耗散功率的变化，如果有变化的话。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7 Thermal   conduction   is   the   transfer   of   thermal   energy   (heat)   through   a   material   with   no   overall movement    of    the    material.    An    apparatus    consisting    of    an    aluminium    rod    surrounded    by insulation is placed between two baths of water, as shown in Fig. 7.1.
texts.text: 7 Thermal   conduction   is   the   transfer   of   thermal   energy   (heat)   through   a   material   with   no   overall movement    of    the    material.    An    apparatus    consisting    of    an    aluminium    rod    surrounded    by insulation is placed between two baths of water, as shown in Fig. 7.1.
texts.translated_text: 7 热传导是通过物质传递热能（热量），而物质本身没有总体移动。如图7.1所示，一个由铝棒和保温材料组成的装置被放置在两个水浴之间。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The   baths    of    water    are    maintained    at    temperatures    of    100 o C   and    45 o C.   The    length    of    the aluminium    rod    between    the    baths    of    water    is    25.0 cm.    The    apparatus    is    left until    the temperature at any point along the rod does not change.
texts.text: The   baths    of    water    are    maintained    at    temperatures    of    100 o C   and    45 o C.   The    length    of    the aluminium    rod    between    the    baths    of    water    is    25.0 cm.    The    apparatus    is    left until    the temperature at any point along the rod does not change.
texts.translated_text: 水浴的温度分别保持在100°C和45°C。铝杆两端分别浸入这两个水浴中，铝杆的长度为25.0厘米。将装置放置直到铝杆上任何一点的温度不再变化。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The rate of thermal conduction through the rod   can be expressed as dQ dt
texts.text: The rate of thermal conduction through the rod   can be expressed as dQ dt
texts.translated_text: 热传导率可以通过细杆的 dQ/dt 来表示。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: where k is    the    thermal   conductivity    of    the    material    of    the    rod, A is    the    cross-sectional   area perpendicular to the direction of thermal conduction and is the temperature gradient.
texts.text: where k is    the    thermal   conductivity    of    the    material    of    the    rod, A is    the    cross-sectional   area perpendicular to the direction of thermal conduction and is the temperature gradient.
texts.translated_text: 其中k是杆材料的热导率，A是垂直于热传导方向的横截面积，而 是温度梯度。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) (i) The SI unit for thermal conductivity is W   m -1
texts.text: (a) (i) The SI unit for thermal conductivity is W   m -1

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Use the unit to deduce what is meant by thermal   conductivity of a material.
texts.text: Use the unit to deduce what is meant by thermal   conductivity of a material.
texts.translated_text: 利用该单位推导出材料的热导率所指的意思。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Suggest one method    that    can    increase    the    rate    of    thermal    conduction    through    a material.
texts.text: (ii) Suggest one method    that    can    increase    the    rate    of    thermal    conduction    through    a material.
texts.translated_text: 提出一种可以增加材料中热传导率的方法。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Fig. 7.2 shows the variation of the temperature T of the rod with the distance x from the hotter bath of water.
texts.text: (b) Fig. 7.2 shows the variation of the temperature T of the rod with the distance x from the hotter bath of water.
texts.translated_text: 图7.2显示了杆的温度T随远离热水浴的距离x的变化情况。

texts.text: (i) Use Fig. 7.2 to determine the temperature gradient.

texts.text: (ii) Hence, calculate the rate of thermal conduction   through the aluminium rod.

texts.label: text

texts.text: The rod has a diameter of 5.0 cm and the thermal conductivity of aluminium is 205 W m    -1    K -1 .
texts.translated_text: 该杆的直径为5.0厘米，铝的热导率为205 W/m·K。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: One   of   the   water   baths    and   insulation   surrounding   the   aluminium   rod   is   removed,   with   one end   of   the   rod still   maintained   at   a   temperature   of   100    o C   using   the   hotter   bath   of   water. The apparatus is left until the temperature at any point along the rod does not change.
texts.text: One   of   the   water   baths    and   insulation   surrounding   the   aluminium   rod   is   removed,   with   one end   of   the   rod still   maintained   at   a   temperature   of   100    o C   using   the   hotter   bath   of   water. The apparatus is left until the temperature at any point along the rod does not change.
texts.translated_text: 将铝杆周围的其中一个水浴和保温层移除，同时用较热的水浴保持杆的一端温度为100℃。让装置静置直到杆上任意一点的温度不再变化。

texts.label: text

texts.translated_text: 图7.4显示了杆的温度T随距水浴距离x的变化。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An experiment is conducted in room temperature of 20    o    C using the apparatus in Fig. 7.3. Data collected from the experiment are tabulated in Table 7.5.
texts.text: An experiment is conducted in room temperature of 20    o    C using the apparatus in Fig. 7.3. Data collected from the experiment are tabulated in Table 7.5.
texts.translated_text: 在20℃的室温下使用图7.3所示的装置进行了一项实验。实验收集的数据列于表7.5中。

texts.text: Answer any one question from this Section in the spaces   provided.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) State   the   relationship   between   the   change   in   linear   momentum   of   an   object,   the   constant force acting on the object, and the time for which the force acts.
texts.text: (ii) State   the   relationship   between   the   change   in   linear   momentum   of   an   object,   the   constant force acting on the object, and the time for which the force acts.
texts.translated_text: 物体的线性动量变化与其所受恒定力以及该力的作用时间之间的关系。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Fig.   8.1   shows   body   A   of   mass m    A with   speed u A and   a   body   B   of   mass m    B with   speed u B approaching each other.
texts.text: (b) Fig.   8.1   shows   body   A   of   mass m    A with   speed u A and   a   body   B   of   mass m    B with   speed u B approaching each other.
texts.translated_text: 图8.1显示质量为mA的速度为uA的物体A和质量为mB的速度为uB的物体B正相互接近。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: During   a   head-on   elastic   collision   between   A   and   B,   the   force   that   A   exerts   on   B   varies   with time in the way shown in Fig. 8.2.
texts.text: During   a   head-on   elastic   collision   between   A   and   B,   the   force   that   A   exerts   on   B   varies   with time in the way shown in Fig. 8.2.
texts.translated_text: 在A和B之间的正面对心弹性碰撞中，A对B的作用力随时间的变化如图8.2所示。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) State the principle of conservation of momentum.
texts.text: (i) State the principle of conservation of momentum.
texts.translated_text: 动量守恒原理是：一个系统如果不受外力作用或者所受合外力为零，那么这个系统的总动量保持不变。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: On Fig. 8.2, sketch a graph of the force that   B exerts on A. [1]
texts.text: On Fig. 8.2, sketch a graph of the force that   B exerts on A. [1]
texts.translated_text: 在图8.2中，绘制B对A的作用力的图形。[1]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) Explain    how    your    answer    to (b)(ii) is    consistent    with    the    principle    of    conservation    of momentum.
texts.text: (iii) Explain    how    your    answer    to (b)(ii) is    consistent    with    the    principle    of    conservation    of momentum.
texts.translated_text: 解释你的(b)(ii)答案是如何与动量守恒原理一致的。

Label    the    graphs    clearly.    Include   appropriate   values   of   the initial and final velocities of A and B on the vertical axis.
texts.text: 2. sketch   the   variation   with   time   of   the   velocities   of   A   and   B,   before,   during   and   after   the collision    on    Fig.    8.4.    Label    the    graphs    clearly.    Include   appropriate   values   of   the initial and final velocities of A and B on the vertical axis.
texts.translated_text: 在图8.4中，绘制A和B在碰撞前、碰撞中和碰撞后的速度随时间变化的曲线，并清楚地标明这些图形。在纵轴上包括A和B的初始速度和最终速度的适当值。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) In a traffic accident, a truck of mass 1.2 ×   10 4    kg collides into the back of a car of mass 1.2 × 10    3    kg. A constant force of 7.2 × 10    4    N acts   for 0.25 s during the collision.
texts.text: (c) In a traffic accident, a truck of mass 1.2 ×   10 4    kg collides into the back of a car of mass 1.2 × 10    3    kg. A constant force of 7.2 × 10    4    N acts   for 0.25 s during the collision.
texts.translated_text: 在一次交通事故中，一辆质量为1.2×10^4千克的卡车撞上了一辆质量为1.2×10^3千克的小汽车。碰撞过程中有一个恒定力7.2×10^4牛顿作用了0.25秒。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Calculate the change in velocity of the car   and the truck.
texts.text: (i) Calculate the change in velocity of the car   and the truck.
texts.translated_text: 计算汽车和卡车的速度变化。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (ii) With   reference    to    Newton's   second   law,   explain   how   an   airbag   in   a   car   reduces   injury   to the driver in the event of a collision.
texts.text: (ii) With   reference    to    Newton's   second   law,   explain   how   an   airbag   in   a   car   reduces   injury   to the driver in the event of a collision.
texts.translated_text: 根据牛顿第二定律，解释汽车在碰撞时安全气囊如何减少对司机的伤害。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Fig.    9.1    is    a   full    scale   diagram   showing    two    long    straight    parallel    copper   wires   X   and   Y clamped vertically, viewed from the top.
texts.text: (b) Fig.    9.1    is    a   full    scale   diagram   showing    two    long    straight    parallel    copper   wires   X   and   Y clamped vertically, viewed from the top.
texts.translated_text: 图9.1是一个全尺寸示意图，展示了两根竖直固定的平行铜导线X和Y，从顶部看的视图。

texts.text: The current in wire X is 5.0 A and that in wire Y is 10.0 A.
texts.translated_text: 导线X中的电流为5.0安培，导线Y中的电流为10.0安培。

texts.label: text

texts.text: Calculate   the   magnitude   of   the   resultant   magnetic   flux   density   at   point   Z   as   shown   in Fig. 9.1.
texts.translated_text: 计算图9.1所示点Z处的合成磁通密度的大小。

texts.text: A probe is used to measure the magnetic flux   density at point Z.
texts.translated_text: 一个探针用于测量点Z的磁通密度。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suggest two possible   reasons   why   the   answer   in (b)(ii) may   be   significantly   different from the one measured by the probe.
texts.text: Suggest two possible   reasons   why   the   answer   in (b)(ii) may   be   significantly   different from the one measured by the probe.
texts.translated_text: 建议两个可能导致(b)(ii)中的答案与探测器测量的结果有显著差异的原因。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) A   metal    rod    of    mass   6.5   g   and   diameter   2.0   mm   is   placed   on   top   of   two   smooth   parallel rails   which   are   inclined   at   an   angle   of   30 o with   the   horizontal,   as   shown   in   Fig.   9.2   and   Fig. 9.3. The    metal    rod    is    connected    across    a    battery    of    e.m.f.    6.0    V.    The    whole    set    up    is placed in a region with a non-uniform magnetic field acting vertically downwards.
texts.text: (c) A   metal    rod    of    mass   6.5   g   and   diameter   2.0   mm   is   placed   on   top   of   two   smooth   parallel rails   which   are   inclined   at   an   angle   of   30 o with   the   horizontal,   as   shown   in   Fig.   9.2   and   Fig. 9.3. The    metal    rod    is    connected    across    a    battery    of    e.m.f.    6.0    V.    The    whole    set    up    is placed in a region with a non-uniform magnetic field acting vertically downwards.
texts.translated_text: 一根质量为6.5克，直径为2.0毫米的金属棒放置在两根光滑平行的导轨上，这两根导轨与水平面成30度角，如图9.2和图9.3所示。金属棒连接在一个电动势为6.0伏特的电池上。整个装置置于一个垂直向下的非均匀磁场区域中。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Indicate   with    an    arrow    on    Fig.    9.2   the   direction   of   current   in   the   metal   rod   to   keep   it stationary on the rail. [1]
texts.text: (i) Indicate   with    an    arrow    on    Fig.    9.2   the   direction   of   current   in   the   metal   rod   to   keep   it stationary on the rail. [1]
texts.translated_text: 在图9.2中，用箭头表示金属杆中的电流方向，以使其在导轨上保持静止。[1]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) If    the   electrical    resistivity    of    the    material    of    the    rod    is    9.7   ×   10 -8 Ω   m,   show   that   the current in the metal rod is 650 A.
texts.text: (ii) If    the   electrical    resistivity    of    the    material    of    the    rod    is    9.7   ×   10 -8 Ω   m,   show   that   the current in the metal rod is 650 A.
texts.translated_text: 如果该金属棒材料的电阻率为 9.7 × 10^-8 Ω·m，证明通过金属棒的电流为 650 A。

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Fig.   9.4   shows   the   variation   of   magnetic   flux   density B with   horizontal   displacement r from bottom of the rail.
texts.text: Fig.   9.4   shows   the   variation   of   magnetic   flux   density B with   horizontal   displacement r from bottom of the rail.
texts.translated_text: 图9.4显示了磁通密度B随距轨底水平位移r的变化。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) The   metal    rod    is   placed   at   a   position   P   on   the   rail   such   that   it   will   remain   stationary. Use Fig. 9.4 to determine the value of r at P.
texts.text: (iii) The   metal    rod    is   placed   at   a   position   P   on   the   rail   such   that   it   will   remain   stationary. Use Fig. 9.4 to determine the value of r at P.
texts.translated_text: （iii）将金属棒放置在导轨上的位置P，使其保持静止。利用图9.4确定P处r的值。

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (iv) If the rails are not perfectly smooth, explain   the following observations.
texts.text: (iv) If the rails are not perfectly smooth, explain   the following observations.
texts.translated_text: 如果轨道不是完全光滑，解释以下观察结果。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The   rod   can   be   placed   a   certain   distance   above   point   P   and   still   remain stationary.
texts.text: 1. The   rod   can   be   placed   a   certain   distance   above   point   P   and   still   remain stationary.
texts.translated_text: 这根杆可以放在点P上方一定距离处仍然保持静止。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The   rod   can   be   placed   a   certain   distance   below   point   P   and   still   remain stationary.
texts.text: 2. The   rod   can   be   placed   a   certain   distance   below   point   P   and   still   remain stationary.
texts.translated_text: 2. 这根杆可以放在点P下方一定距离处仍然保持静止。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) The   metal   rod   in (c) is   then   placed   in   a   region   of   uniform   magnetic   field   and   made   to   move at constant speed.  Fig. 9.5 shows the microscopic view of an electron in the metal rod.
texts.text: (d) The   metal   rod   in (c) is   then   placed   in   a   region   of   uniform   magnetic   field   and   made   to   move at constant speed.  Fig. 9.5 shows the microscopic view of an electron in the metal rod.
texts.translated_text: (d) 将(c)中的金属棒放在一个均匀磁场区域中，并使其以恒定速度移动。图9.5显示了金属棒中电子的微观视图。

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Draw   an   arrow    on    Fig.    9.5   to   show   the   direction   of   the   magnetic   force   acting   on   the electron. Label it F. [1]
texts.text: (i) Draw   an   arrow    on    Fig.    9.5   to   show   the   direction   of   the   magnetic   force   acting   on   the electron. Label it F. [1]
texts.translated_text: 在图9.5上画一个箭头以表示作用在电子上的磁力的方向，并标上F。[1]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Suggest   why   there   is   potential   difference   across   the   rod   when   it   is   moving   at   constant speed.
texts.text: (ii) Suggest   why   there   is   potential   difference   across   the   rod   when   it   is   moving   at   constant speed.
texts.translated_text: (ii) 建议当棒以恒定速度移动时，为什么棒两端会存在电势差。
